com.percussion.services.filter
Interface IPSFilterItem

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable
All Known Implementing Classes:
PSBaseSlotContentFinder.SlotItem, PSContentListItem, com.percussion.services.filter.data.PSFilterItem
public interface IPSFilterItem
extends Cloneable

Represents an item to be filtered. Items are considered immutable in filter rules. If a modification is required, clone the item and modify the clone.

Author:
dougrand

Method Detail

getItemId

IPSGuid getItemId()
Get the item's identifying guid

Returns:
the item's guid, never null

Returns:

getSiteId

IPSGuid getSiteId()
Get the item's containing site guid

Returns:

getKey

Object getKey()
A number of operations require deciding if a filter item is in a set or map. But the items are mutable, which can render these maps and sets invalid. This method returns an opaque key that can be used for this purpose. The returned key is not dependent on the specific revision of the item, but will be dependent on the folder and site.

Note to implementers, do not use an array for this purpose. Java does not hash arrays, it uses the default hash code calculation. This will not work properly.

Returns:
an opaque key, never null, that identifies the tuple content item id, folder id and site id.

clone

IPSFilterItem clone(IPSGuid newItemId)
Make a clone and replace the item id. This is provided to enable implementers who need to return a modified item in the result set of a filter to create a clone to modify. The original item should be considered immutable. The returned object will not be equals to the original object (unless the new id happens to be the same).

Note that the general clone method is not guaranteed to be present.

Parameters:
newItemId - the new item id, never null
Returns:
the cloned and modified object

setItemId

void setItemId(IPSGuid newId)
Set a new item id, this must only be called on a cloned object.

Parameters:
newId - the new item id, never null.

setFolderId

void setFolderId(IPSGuid newId)
Set a new folder id, this must only be called on a cloned object.

Parameters:
newId - the new folder id, never null.

setSiteId

void setSiteId(IPSGuid newId)
Set a new site id, this must only be called on a cloned object.

Parameters:
newId - the new item id, never null.
